unnormalised: Delhi Police have filed a charge sheet against Munna Bhai, oops, I mean, Mr. Murari Lal, under IPC Section 420 for allegedly selling snake oil as a miracle cure for baldness. Seems like someone forgot to read the fine print (or maybe they couldn't see it with all that hair in their eyes... or lack thereof!).
normalised: Delhi Police have filed a charge sheet against Munna Bhai, oops, I mean, Mister Murari Lal, under I-P-C Section four hundred and twenty for allegedly selling snake oil as a miracle cure for baldness. Seems like someone forgot to read the fine print (or maybe they couldn't see it with all that hair in their eyes... or lack thereof!).

unnormalised: The complainant, Mr. Rajesh Sharma, claims he saw Mr. Lal’s ad on Facebook promising guaranteed hair growth in 30 days for just Rs. 2500. Sharma ji, desperate to impress his rishta prospects, applied the oil religiously but ended up looking like a plucked chicken.
normalised: The complainant, Mister Rajesh Sharma, claims he saw Mister Lal's ad on Facebook promising guaranteed hair growth in thirty days for just rupee two thousand five hundred. Sharma ji, desperate to impress his rishta prospects, applied the oil religiously but ended up looking like a plucked chicken.

unnormalised: According to the FIR, Lal apparently claimed his product was blessed by a “hair-raising baba” from the Himalayas. One can only imagine the baba’s reaction to this news! Legal eagles are already buzzing, with Adv. Tripathi reportedly quipping, "This case will be hair today, gone tomorrow... hopefully for Mr. Lal!"
normalised: According to the F-I-R, Lal apparently claimed his product was blessed by a “hair-raising baba” from the Himalayas. One can only imagine the baba's reaction to this news! Legal eagles are already buzzing, with Advocate Tripathi reportedly quipping, "This case will be hair today, gone tomorrow... hopefully for Mister Lal!"

unnormalised: The police seized several bottles of the alleged "miracle oil," which, preliminary investigations suggest, might be a mix of coconut oil and something vaguely resembling turmeric. Talk about a close shave with justice!
normalised: The police seized several bottles of the alleged "miracle oil," which, preliminary investigations suggest, might be a mix of coconut oil and something vaguely resembling turmeric. Talk about a close shave with justice!

unnormalised: If convicted, Mr. Lal could face jail time and a permanent ban from the beauty industry. Maybe he should consider a career change – perhaps selling wigs? At least that's honest... and doesn't require Himalayan blessings!
normalised: If convicted, Mister Lal could face jail time and a permanent ban from the beauty industry. Maybe he should consider a career change – perhaps selling wigs? At least that's honest... and doesn't require Himalayan blessings!
